cards.name: Flame Lance
cards.flavor: It's on the rack next to ice lance, acid lance, and English muffin lance.
cards.text: Deal $8 damage to a minion.

cards.name: Effigy
cards.flavor: Burning man, brah.
cards.text: Secret: When a friendly minion dies, summon a random minion with the same Cost.

cards.name: Fallen Hero
cards.flavor: And he can't get up.
cards.text: Your Hero Power deals 1 extra damage.

cards.name: Arcane Blast
cards.flavor: Now with 100% more blast!
cards.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. This spell gets double bonus from Spell Damage.

cards.name: Polymorph: Boar
cards.flavor: It's always Huffer.
cards.text: Transform a minion into a 4/2 Boar with Charge.

cards.name: Dalaran Aspirant
cards.flavor: Is he aspiring or inspiring?  Make up your mind!
cards.text: Inspire: Gain Spell Damage +1.

cards.name: Spellslinger
cards.flavor: Does he sling spells, or do his spells linger about.  Who can say?
cards.text: Battlecry: Add a random spell to each player's hand.

cards.name: Coldarra Drake
cards.flavor: The Grand Tournament has a 'No dragons allowed' policy, but it's rarely enforced.
cards.text: You can use your Hero Power any number of times.

cards.name: Rhonin
cards.flavor: A masterless shamurai.
cards.text: Deathrattle: Add 3 copies of Arcane Missiles to your hand.

cards.name: Ram Wrangler
cards.flavor: Not getting trampled is really the trick here.
cards.text: Battlecry: If you have a Beast, summon a random Beast.

cards.name: Holy Champion
cards.flavor: She really likes seeing people get better.  That's why she hurts them in the first place.
cards.text: Whenever a character is healed, gain +2 Attack.

cards.name: Spawn of Shadows
cards.flavor: What did you expect to happen?  He's a Spawn.  Of Shadows.
cards.text: Inspire: Deal 4 damage to each hero.

cards.name: Power Word: Glory
cards.flavor: The promise of glory is a powerful tool to get minions to do your bidding.  Only slightly less powerful than the promise of an ice cream bar!
cards.text: Choose a minion. Whenever it attacks, restore 4 Health to your hero.

cards.name: Shadowfiend
cards.flavor: Hopes to be promoted to 'Shadowfriend' someday.
cards.text: Whenever you draw a card, reduce its Cost by (1).

cards.name: Convert
cards.flavor: 'Are you interested in... HEALTH benefits?!'
cards.text: Put a copy of an enemy minion into your hand.

cards.name: Confuse
cards.flavor: This minion is really powerful!
cards.text: Swap the Attack and Health of all minions.

cards.name: Twilight Guardian
cards.flavor: A result of magical experiments carried out by the Black Dragonflight, it's not his fault that he's a vicious killer.
cards.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Taunt.

cards.name: Confessor Paletress
cards.flavor: She sees into your past and makes you face your fears.  Most common fear:  Getting Majordomo out of Sneed's Old Shredder.
cards.text: Inspire: Summon a random Legendary minion.

cards.name: Dreadsteed
cards.flavor: Crescendo himself summoned this steed, riding it to victory in the Grand Tournament.  Wherever he rides, an army of riders ride behind him, supporting the legendary champion.
cards.text: Deathrattle: At the end  of the turn, summon a Dreadsteed.

cards.name: Fearsome Doomguard
cards.flavor: They were originally called Cuddleguards, but they were not inspiring the proper amount of fear.

cards.name: Tiny Knight of Evil
cards.flavor: 'No, no, no. I asked for a tiny JESTER of evil.'
cards.text: Whenever you discard a card, gain +1/+1.

cards.name: Fist of Jaraxxus
cards.flavor: * Not actually Jaraxxus' fist.
cards.text: When you play or discard this, deal $4 damage to a random enemy.

cards.name: Void Crusher
cards.flavor: We like to call him 'Wesley'.
cards.text: Inspire: Destroy a random minion for each player.

cards.name: Demonfuse
cards.flavor: Very dangerous when attached to a demonbomb.
cards.text: Give a Demon +3/+3. Give your opponent a Mana Crystal.

cards.name: Dark Bargain
cards.flavor: A prime example of lose-lose negotiating.
cards.text: Destroy 2 random enemy minions. Discard 2 random cards.

cards.name: Wrathguard
cards.flavor: After playing against 5 Annoy-O-Trons, any normal guard will become a Wrathguard.
cards.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, also deal that amount to your hero.

cards.name: Wilfred Fizzlebang
cards.flavor: He can summon anything, even a FEARSOME DOOMGUARD*. *He's pretty sure this is going to work out.
cards.text: Cards you draw from your Hero Power cost (0).

cards.name: Shado-Pan Rider
cards.flavor: He needed a break after that business in the Vale of Eternal Blossoms. Naturally, he chose to spend his vacation in an icy snowscape killing monsters.
cards.text: Combo: Gain +3 Attack.

cards.name: Buccaneer
cards.flavor: The best part of buccaneering is the pants.
cards.text: Whenever you equip a weapon, give it +1 Attack.

cards.name: Undercity Valiant
cards.flavor: Almost went to play for Stormwind before signing with Undercity.
cards.text: Combo: Deal 1 damage.

cards.name: Cutpurse
cards.flavor: He has a giant collection of purses now.  One for every outfit!
cards.text: Whenever this minion attacks a hero, add the Coin to your hand.

cards.name: Shady Dealer
cards.flavor: I have great deal for you... for 4 damage to your face!
cards.text: Battlecry: If you have a Pirate, gain +1/+1.

cards.name: Burgle
cards.flavor: Yoink!
cards.text: Add 2 random class cards to your hand (from your opponent's class).

cards.name: Poisoned Blade
cards.flavor: How much more poisoned can a blade get?  The answer is a lot.  A lot more poisoned.
cards.text: Your Hero Power gives this weapon +1 Attack instead of replacing it.

cards.name: Beneath the Grounds
cards.flavor: Can you hold these eggs for just a second?  I promise they're not full of giant enraged undead spider things.
cards.text: Shuffle 3 Ambushes into your opponent's deck. When drawn, you summon a 4/4 Nerubian.

cards.name: Anub'arak
cards.flavor: Was actually a pretty nice guy before, you know, the whole Lich King thing.
cards.text: Deathrattle: Return this to your hand and summon a 4/4 Nerubian.

cards.name: Living Roots
cards.flavor: 2 out of 2 saplings recommend that you summon the saplings.
cards.text: Choose One - Deal $2 damage; or Summon two 1/1 Saplings.

cards.name: Darnassus Aspirant
cards.flavor: She loves mana crystals, she hates mana crystals.   So fickle!
cards.text: Battlecry: Gain an empty Mana Crystal. Deathrattle: Lose a Mana Crystal.

cards.name: Savage Combatant
cards.flavor: Maybe if you whistle a tune it will soothe him.  Yeah...  Try that.
cards.text: Inspire: Give your hero +2 Attack this turn.

cards.name: Wildwalker
cards.flavor: She was born to be something.  She is just not quite sure what yet...
cards.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly Beast +3 Health.

cards.name: Knight of the Wild
cards.flavor: He gets a discount on the tournament entry fee because he is his own horse.
cards.text: Whenever you summon a Beast, reduce the Cost of this card by (1).

cards.name: Druid of the Saber
cards.flavor: That's saberTEETH, not like curved pirate blades.  That's a different kind of druid.  Druid of the Curved Pirate Blades.
cards.text: Choose One - Transform into a 2/1 with Charge; or a 3/2 with Stealth.

cards.name: Astral Communion
cards.flavor: Hey!  Moon!  Can I have some mana crystals?
cards.text: Gain 10 Mana Crystals. Discard your hand.

cards.name: Mulch
cards.flavor: Is this a noun or a verb?  We will never know.
cards.text: Destroy a minion. Add a random minion to your opponent's hand.

cards.name: Aviana
cards.flavor: Call her 'Tweety'.  She'll find it real funny.  I PROMISE.
cards.text: Your minions cost (1).

cards.name: Tuskarr Totemic
cards.flavor: Turns out the tuskarr aren't real choosy about their totems.
cards.text: Battlecry: Summon a random basic Totem.

cards.name: Draenei Totemcarver
cards.flavor: It's nice to find a real craftsman in this day and age of mass-produced totems.
cards.text: Battlecry: Gain +1/+1 for each friendly Totem.

cards.name: Healing Wave
cards.flavor: Favored by shaman who study the art of restoration and healing, this spell would feel smug, if it had feelings.
cards.text: Restore #7 Health. Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, Restore #14 instead.

cards.name: Thunder Bluff Valiant
cards.flavor: Allowing totems to attack is not cheating.  I mean, there isn't anything in the rule books about it.
cards.text: Inspire: Give your Totems +2 Attack.

cards.name: Charged Hammer
cards.flavor: You can only pick it up if you are worthy.
cards.text: Deathrattle: Your Hero Power becomes 'Deal 2 damage.'

cards.name: Elemental Destruction
cards.flavor: I'm not a shaman or anything, but isn't Elemental Destruction the opposite of what they want to do?
cards.text: Deal $4-$5 damage to all minions. Overload: (5)

cards.name: Totem Golem
cards.flavor: What happens when you glue a buncha totems together.
cards.text: Overload: (1)

cards.name: Ancestral Knowledge
cards.flavor: MOMMMMMYYYYYYYYY!!!
cards.text: Draw 2 cards. Overload: (2)

cards.name: The Mistcaller
cards.flavor: Calling the mist doesn't sound all that great.  'Ooooh, it is slightly damp now!'
cards.text: Battlecry: Give all minions in your hand and deck +1/+1.

cards.name: Flash Heal
cards.flavor: Flash!  Ahhhhhhh~
cards.text: Restore #5 Health.

cards.name: Powershot
cards.flavor: pow POW pow
cards.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion and the minions next to it.

cards.name: Stablemaster
cards.flavor: Takes way better care of her pets than her brother, Unstablemaster.
cards.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly Beast Immune this turn.

cards.name: King's Elekk
cards.flavor: Elekk jousting is AWESOME.
cards.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, draw it.

cards.name: Brave Archer
cards.flavor: This is a 'bearly' concealed reference.
cards.text: Inspire: If your hand is empty, deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.

cards.name: Bear Trap
cards.flavor: You'll never guess what's in that conveniently bear-sized, bear-smelling box.
cards.text: Secret: After your hero is attacked, summon a 3/3 Bear with Taunt.

cards.name: Lock and Load
cards.flavor: Rexxar narrowed his eyes, grabbed his machine gun, and said: 'It's go time.  Lock and load.' This card pays homage to that special moment.
cards.text: Each time you cast a spell this turn, add a random Hunter card to your hand.

cards.name: Ball of Spiders
cards.flavor: 'THEY'RE EVERYWHERE GET THEM OFF!!!' - Everyone
cards.text: Summon three 1/1 Webspinners.

cards.name: Acidmaw
cards.flavor: With the help of his trusty sidekick Dreadscale, the giant jormungar Acidmaw is ready to face any knight!
cards.text: Whenever another minion takes damage, destroy it.

cards.name: Dreadscale
cards.flavor: Let's be clear about this:  ACIDMAW is the sidekick.
cards.text: At the end of your turn, deal 1 damage to all other minions.

cards.name: Bash
cards.flavor: You might think bashing doesn't take a lot of practice.  It doesn't.
cards.text: Deal $3 damage. Gain 3 Armor.

cards.name: King's Defender
cards.flavor: 'King's Attacker' is a shield.  Funny, huh?
cards.text: Battlecry: If you have a minion with Taunt, gain +1 Durability.

cards.name: Orgrimmar Aspirant
cards.flavor: 'Four out of three orcs struggle with math.' - Angry Zurge
cards.text: Inspire: Give your weapon +1 Attack.

cards.name: Magnataur Alpha
cards.flavor: Playing him also gets you into the Magnataur Beta.
cards.text: Also damages the minions next to whomever he attacks.

cards.name: Bolster
cards.flavor: The best offense is a good defense.
cards.text: Give your Taunt minions +2/+2.

cards.name: Sparring Partner
cards.flavor: Come at me, bro.
cards.text: Taunt Battlecry: Give a minion Taunt.

cards.name: Skycap'n Kragg
cards.flavor: What's more boss than riding a parrot with a jawbone for a shoulderpad while wielding a giant hook-lance-thing and wearing a pirate hat?  NOTHING.
cards.text: Charrrrrge Costs (1) less for each friendly Pirate.

cards.name: Alexstrasza's Champion
cards.flavor: 'Put more spikes on her.  No, more spikes.  What part of 'more spikes' do you not understand?  MORE SPIKES!' - Alexstrasza
cards.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Charge.

cards.name: Varian Wrynn
cards.flavor: Leader of the Alliance!  Father of Anduin!  Also he likes to play Arena, and he averages 12 wins.
cards.text: Battlecry: Draw 3 cards. Put any minions you drew directly into the battlefield.

cards.name: Competitive Spirit
cards.flavor: Competition can be an inspiration to improve oneself.  Or kill all the competitors.
cards.text: Secret: When your turn starts, give your minions +1/+1.

cards.name: Seal of Champions
cards.flavor: 'Arf! Arf! Arf!' - Seal of Champions
cards.text: Give a minion +3 Attack and Divine Shield.

cards.name: Warhorse Trainer
cards.flavor: He doesn't even get Sundays off.  Every day he's hostling.
cards.text: Your Silver Hand Recruits have +1 Attack.

cards.name: Murloc Knight
cards.flavor: Hee hee!  Look at his cute little feet.
cards.text: Inspire: Summon a random Murloc.

cards.name: Argent Lance
cards.flavor: The stripes make it look like a candy cane, but we recommend against licking it.
cards.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, +1 Durability.

cards.name: Enter the Coliseum
cards.flavor: You have to get past the vendors first.  So many are lost to shopping...
cards.text: Destroy all minions except each player's highest Attack minion.

cards.name: Mysterious Challenger
cards.flavor: He may sound surly and antisocial, but he's actually just really shy.
cards.text: Battlecry: Put one of each Secret from your deck into the battlefield.

cards.name: Garrison Commander
cards.flavor: He'll never admit it, but he pushes you hard because he really cares about you.
cards.text: You can use your Hero Power twice a turn.

cards.name: Eadric the Pure
cards.flavor: Nobody rocks a monocle like Eadric.
cards.text: Battlecry: Change all enemy minions' Attack to 1.

cards.name: Lowly Squire
cards.flavor: But not the lowliest!
cards.text: Inspire: Gain +1 Attack.

cards.name: Dragonhawk Rider
cards.flavor: Check it out.  You can do barrel rolls on this thing.
cards.text: Inspire: Gain Windfury this turn.

cards.name: Lance Carrier
cards.flavor: Lance Carrier is an obscure entry level position in orcish armies.  A mystery, since orcs don't generally use lances.
cards.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion +2 Attack.

cards.name: Maiden of the Lake
cards.flavor: Not a good basis for a system of government.
cards.text: Your Hero Power costs (1).

cards.name: Saboteur
cards.flavor: Listen all y'all it's a saboteur!
cards.text: Battlecry: Your opponent's Hero Power costs (5) more next turn.

cards.name: Argent Horserider
cards.flavor: His horse's name is Betsy.
cards.text: Charge Divine Shield

cards.name: Mogor's Champion
cards.flavor: This champion has learned from the best.  Except for his target selection.
cards.text: 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.

cards.name: Boneguard Lieutenant
cards.flavor: Underneath all that impressive armor, he's just skin and bones.  Okay, maybe just bones.
cards.text: Inspire: Gain +1 Health.

cards.name: Mukla's Champion
cards.flavor: An elegant gorilla, for a more civilized age.
cards.text: Inspire: Give your other minions +1/+1.

cards.name: Tournament Medic
cards.flavor: The medic tournament is less entertaining than the Grand Tournament.
cards.text: Inspire: Restore 2 Health to your hero.

cards.name: Ice Rager
cards.flavor: He's a lot cooler than Magma Rager.

cards.name: Frigid Snobold
cards.flavor: Ironically, the natural enemy of the snobold is THE CANDLE.
cards.text: Spell Damage +1

cards.name: Flame Juggler
cards.flavor: At first he liked juggling chain saws, but then he thought, 'Flames are better!  Because FIRE!'
cards.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to a random enemy.

cards.name: Silent Knight
cards.flavor: He used to be a librarian.  Old habits die hard.
cards.text: Stealth Divine Shield

cards.name: Clockwork Knight
cards.flavor: It takes a lot to wind him up.
cards.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly Mech +1/+1.

cards.name: Tournament Attendee
cards.flavor: He was so excited to get season tickets to this year's Grand Tournament.  He normally doesn't get them at first and has to buy them from Ogre scalpers.
cards.text: Taunt

cards.name: Sideshow Spelleater
cards.flavor: Hey!  Let me try that...
cards.text: Battlecry: Copy your opponent's Hero Power.

cards.name: Kodorider
cards.flavor: Someone called her a Rhinorider, and she's NOT HAPPY.
cards.text: Inspire: Summon a 3/5 War Kodo.

cards.name: Silver Hand Regent
cards.flavor: The Silver Hand is the best paladin organization.  The Argent Crusaders are super jealous.
cards.text: Inspire: Summon a 1/1 Silver Hand Recruit.

cards.name: Pit Fighter
cards.flavor: What did the pits ever do to you?

cards.name: Captured Jormungar
cards.flavor: You can keep him, but you have to promise to feed him and clean out his tank every day!

cards.name: North Sea Kraken
cards.flavor: You have no idea how tired this guy is of being released.
cards.text: Battlecry: Deal 4 damage.

cards.name: Tuskarr Jouster
cards.flavor: Just could not be talked out of using his turtle for the joust...
cards.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, restore 7 Health to your hero.

cards.name: Injured Kvaldir
cards.flavor: Don't worry.  With a little skin cream he's going to clear right up.
cards.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage to this minion.

cards.name: Light's Champion
cards.flavor: When there's something strange (say, a gibbering demon) in your neighborhood, who are you going to call?
cards.text: Battlecry: Silence a Demon.

cards.name: Armored Warhorse
cards.flavor: Yep.  It's a horse... wearing armor... going to war.
cards.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, gain Charge.

cards.name: Argent Watchman
cards.flavor: Who argent watches the Argent Watchman?
cards.text: Can't attack. Inspire: Can attack as normal this turn.

cards.name: Coliseum Manager
cards.flavor: Meets monthly with the gladiators to discuss career goals.
cards.text: Inspire: Return this minion to your hand.

cards.name: Refreshment Vendor
cards.flavor: Menu:  Funnel cakes, carrots, popcorn, jormungar steaks.  It's hard serving a diverse clientele.
cards.text: Battlecry: Restore 4 Health to each hero.

cards.name: Master Jouster
cards.flavor: Needs just a few more ratings points to become Grandmaster Jouster.
cards.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, gain Taunt and Divine Shield.

cards.name: Recruiter
cards.flavor: Join the Argent Crusade!  We have attractive tabards and you get to carry really nice swords!
cards.text: Inspire: Add a 2/2 Squire to your hand.

cards.name: Evil Heckler
cards.flavor: To be honest, heckling is not the most effective form of evil.
cards.text: Taunt

cards.name: Fencing Coach
cards.flavor: Good fencers make good neighbors, right?
cards.text: Battlecry: The next time you use your Hero Power, it costs (2) less.

cards.name: Wyrmrest Agent
cards.flavor: Keeping tabs on the Grand Tournament is priority #1 for the five mighty Dragonflights!
cards.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Taunt.

cards.name: Master of Ceremonies
cards.flavor: Goes by 'MC ElfyElf'.
cards.text: Battlecry: If you have a minion with Spell Damage, gain +2/+2.

cards.name: Grand Crusader
cards.flavor: A veteran of a number of crusades, she is a force for light and goodness.  Her latest crusade is against goblin telemarketers.
cards.text: Battlecry: Add a random Paladin card to your hand.

cards.name: Kvaldir Raider
cards.flavor: Coming soon... to a tuskarr village near you!
cards.text: Inspire: Gain +2/+2.

cards.name: Frost Giant
cards.flavor: Don't ask him about the beard.  JUST DON'T.
cards.text: Costs (1) less for each time you used your Hero Power this game.

cards.name: Crowd Favorite
cards.flavor: The crowd ALWAYS yells lethal.
cards.text: Whenever you play a card with Battlecry, gain +1/+1.

cards.name: Gormok the Impaler
cards.flavor: Gormok has been giving impaling lessons in a small tent near the tournament grounds.  For only 25g you too could learn the fine art of impaling!
cards.text: Battlecry: If you have at least 4 other minions, deal 4 damage.

cards.name: Chillmaw
cards.flavor: Chillmaw keeps trying to ruin the Grand Tournament, and she would've done it too, if it weren't for those dang kids!
cards.text: Taunt Deathrattle: If you're holding a Dragon, deal 3 damage to all minions.

cards.name: Bolf Ramshield
cards.flavor: Bolf keeps coming in 2nd at the Grand Tournament.  It might be his year this year, if Lebron doesn't enter.
cards.text: Whenever your hero takes damage, this minion takes it instead.

cards.name: Icehowl
cards.flavor: This massive yeti just closes his eyes and charges at the nearest target.  The nearest Target is a couple blocks away and has sick deals on skateboards.
cards.text: Charge Can't attack heroes.

cards.name: Nexus-Champion Saraad
cards.flavor: The ethereals have their own jousting tournament, and Saraad is the reigning champion.  Also he won the ethereal hot dog eating contest.
cards.text: Inspire: Add a random spell to your hand.

cards.name: The Skeleton Knight
cards.flavor: Apparently it really was just a flesh wound.
cards.text: Deathrattle: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, return this to your hand.

cards.name: Fjola Lightbane
cards.flavor: LOVES being called 'the wonder twins'.
cards.text: Whenever you target this minion with a spell, gain Divine Shield.

cards.name: Sea Reaver
cards.flavor: A little better than Sea Minus Reaver.
cards.text: When you draw this, deal 1 damage to your minions.

cards.name: Eydis Darkbane
cards.flavor: HATES being called 'the wonder twins'.
cards.text: Whenever you target this minion with a spell, deal 3 damage to a random enemy.

cards.name: Justicar Trueheart
cards.flavor: It's like putting racing stripes and a giant spoiler on your hero power.
cards.text: Battlecry: Replace your starting Hero Power with a better one.

cards.name: Gadgetzan Jouster
cards.flavor: It's not HER fault you didn't put a spinning saw blade on your horse.
cards.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, gain +1/+1.
